alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 3:00PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Minor flooding will continue from heavy rainfall this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Portions of Interstate 880 remain closed in the Freemont area. Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and water over roadways is also expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 PM PDT, Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Check Caltrans for the latest road closure updates. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Livermore, Mountain View, San Ramon, Pleasanton, Union City, Milpitas, Palo Alto, Dublin, Newark, Menlo Park, Sunol and Los Vaqueros. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
